member.name: T:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration
member.summary: This class is network adapter WMI containter.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.ArpAlwaysSourceRoute
member.summary: If this property set to "TRUE", TCP/IP transmits Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) queries with source routing enabled on Token Ring networks. By default (FALSE), ARP first queries without source routing, and then retries with source routing enabled if no reply is received. Source routing allows the routing of network packets across different types of networks.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.ArpUseEtherSNAP
member.summary: If this property set to "TRUE", Ethernet packets follow the IEEE 802.3 Sub-Network Access Protocol (SNAP) encoding. Setting this parameter to 1 forces TCP/IP to transmit Ethernet packets by using 802.3 SNAP encoding. By default (FALSE), the stack transmits packets in DIX Ethernet format. Windows 2000 systems can receive both

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.Caption
member.summary: Short description of object

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DatabasePath
member.summary:
Valid Windows file path to standard Internet database files (HOSTS, LMHOSTS, NETWORKS, and PROTOCOLS) The file path is used by the Windows Sockets interface. This property is only available on computer systems running Windows 2000.
This file path is used by Windows socket interface.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DeadGWDetectEnabled
member.summary: If this property set to "TRUE", dead gateway detection occurs. With this feature enabled, Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) asks Internet Protocol (IP) to change to a backup gateway if it retransmits a segment several times without receiving a response. If this property is enabled, TCP asks to internet protocol that changes gatewary or not when did not cath reply after sending segment several times.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DefaultIPGateway
member.summary: Array of IP addresses of default gateways that the computer system uses Example: "192.168.12.1 192.168.46.1"

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DefaultTOS
member.summary: Default Type Of Service (TOS) value set in the header of outgoing IP packets defined by RFC 791 Valid ranged is 0~255

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DefaultTTL
member.summary: Default Time To Live (TTL) value set in the header of outgoing IP packets Default value is 32. Valid ranged is 1~255.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.Description
member.summary: Description of object

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DHCPEnabled
member.summary: If this property set to "TRUE", the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) server automatically assigns an IP address to the computer system when establishing a network connection.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DHCPLeaseExpires
member.summary: Expiration date and time for a leased IP address that was assigned to the computer by the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) server Example: 20521201000230.000000000

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DHCPLeaseObtained
member.summary: Date and time the lease was obtained for the IP address assigned to the computer by the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) server Example: 19521201000230.000000000

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DHCPServer
member.summary: IP address of the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) server Example: "10.55.34.2"

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DNSDomain
member.summary: DNS domain name Example: "tap-proejct.com"

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DNSDomainSuffixSearchOrder
member.summary: FQDN Example: "samples.tap-proejct.com example.tap-proejct.com"

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DNSEnabledForWINSResolution
member.summary: If this property set to "TRUE", the Domain Name System (DNS) is enabled for name resolution over Windows Internet Naming Service (WINS) resolution. If the name cannot be resolved using DNS, the name request is forwarded to WINS for resolution.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DNSHostName
member.summary: Host name used to identify the local computer for authentication by some utilities. Other TCP/IP-based utilities can use this value to acquire the name of the local computer. Host names are stored on DNS servers in a table that maps names to IP addresses for use by DNS. The name can be any combination of the letters A through Z, the numerals 0 through 9, and the hyphen (-), plus the period (.) character used as a separator. By default, this value is the Microsoft networking computer name, but the network administrator can assign another host name without affecting the computer name.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DNSServerSearchOrder
member.summary: IP address array for querying to DNS server

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.DomainDNSRegistrationEnabled
member.summary: the IP addresses for this connection are registered in DNS under the domain name of this connection in addition to being registered under the computer's full DNS name. The domain name of this connection is either set using the SetDNSDomain() method or assigned by DSCP. The registered name is the host name of the computer with the domain name appended

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.ForwardBufferMemory
member.summary: Memory allocated by IP to store packet data in the router packet queue. When this buffer space is filled, the router begins discarding packets at random from its queue. Packet queue data buffers are 256 bytes in length, so the value of this parameter should be a multiple of 256. Multiple buffers are chained together for larger packets. The IP header for a packet is stored separately. This parameter is ignored and no buffers are allocated if the IP router is not enabled. The buffer size can range from the network MTU to a value smaller than 0xFFFFFFFF. Default: 74240 (fifty 1480-byte packets, rounded to a multiple of 256)

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.FullDNSRegistrationEnabled
member.summary: If this property set to "TRUE", IP addresses for this connection are registered in DNS under the computer's full DNS name. The full DNS name of the computer is displayed on the Network Identification tab in the System application in Control Panel.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.GatewayCostMetric
member.summary: Integer typed-cost matric value(1-9999) array This value uses for calcuating router that is fastest, reliable and low-costed. This parameter is one to one mapped to DefaultIPGateway property.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.IGMPLevel
member.summary: This property expends system that supports IP multi-casting and joins to IGMP. Level 0 means that system does not support multi-casting. Level 1 means that system supports IP multi-casting for transporing only. Level 2 means that system supports IP multi-casting for transporing and receive multi-casting packet and join to IGMP.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.Index
member.summary:
Index number of Windows network adapter configuration
This number will be used when two or more confiuration is possibled.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.InterfaceIndex
member.summary: Index value for identifacting local network interface

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPAddress
member.summary:
All IP addresses array assigned to current network adapter
This property includes IPv4 address and IPv6 address on Windows vista later verison.
Example IPv6 address: "2010:836B:4179::836B:4179" Example: "172.16.22.0"

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPConnectionMetric
member.summary:
Cost for using route configurated for IP-bounded adapter

Protocol list can be accessed

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.IPSecPermitUDPPorts

member.summary: MTU

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.NumForwardPackets
member.summary:
Number of IP packet header that is assigned to router packet queue
When all header is using, router will start to remove packet randomly. This value must be larger than ForwardBufferMemory value that is devided by max IP data size of connected network. This value must be smaller than ForwardBufferMemory value devided by 256.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.PMTUBHDetectEnabled
member.summary: If this property set to "TRUE", detection of black hole routers occurs while TCP discovers the path of the Maximum Transmission Unit. A black hole router does not return ICMP Destination Unreachable messages when it needs to fragment an IP datagram with the Don't Fragment bit set. TCP depends on receiving these messages to perform Path MTU Discovery. With this feature enabled, TCP will try to send segments without the Don't Fragment bit set if several retransmissions of a segment go unacknowledged. If the segment is acknowledged as a result, the MSS will be decreased and the Don't Fragment bit will be set in future packets on the connection. Enabling black hole detection increases the maximum number of retransmissions performed for a given segment. The default value of this property is FALSE.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.PMTUDiscoveryEnabled
member.summary: If this property set to "TRUE", the Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) path is discovered over the path to a remote host. Default value is "TRUE".

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.TcpMaxConnectRetransmissions
member.summary: Number of times TCP attempts to retransmit a Connect Request before terminating the connection The initial retransmission timeout is 3 seconds. The retransmission timeout doubles for each attempt. Default: 3, Valid Range: 0 - 0xFFFFFFFF.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.TcpMaxDataRetransmissions
member.summary: Number of times TCP retransmits an individual data segment (nonconnect segment) before terminating the connection The retransmission timeout doubles with each successive retransmission on a connection. Default: 5, Valid Range: 0 - 0xFFFFFFFF.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.TcpNumConnections
member.summary: Maximum number of connections that TCP can have open simultaneously Default: 0xFFFFFE, Valid Range: 0 - 0xFFFFFE.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.TcpUseRFC1122UrgentPointer
member.summary: If this property set to "TRUE", TCP uses the RFC 1122 specification for urgent data If FALSE (default), TCP uses the mode used by Berkeley Software Design (BSD) derived systems. The two mechanisms interpret the urgent pointer differently and are not interoperable. The default value is FALSE

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.TcpWindowSize
member.summary: Maximum TCP Receive Window size offered by the system The Receive Window specifies the number of bytes a sender may transmit without receiving an acknowledgment. In general, larger receiving windows will improve performance over high-delay and high-bandwidth networks. For efficiency, the receiving window should be an even multiple of the TCP Maximum Segment Size (MSS). Default: Four times the maximum TCP data size or an even multiple of TCP data size rounded up to the nearest multiple of 8192. Ethernet networks default to 8760. Valid range: 0 - 65535.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.WINSEnableLMHostsLookup
member.summary: If this property set to "TRUE", local lookup files are used. Lookup files will contain a map of IP addresses to host names. If they exist on the local system, they will be found in %SystemRoot%\system32\drivers\etc.

member.name: P:TAP.Base.WMI.Containers.WMINetworkAdapterConfiguration.WINSHostLookupFile
member.summary:
Path to a WINS lookup file on the local system
This file will contain a map of IP addresses to host names. If the file specified in this property is found, it will be copied to the %SystemRoot%\system32\drivers\etc folder of the local system. Valid only if the WINSEnableLMHostsLookup property is TRUE.
